intro: Erigeron poliospermus var. latus, commonly known as the broadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, daisy-like blooms. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. It is an important plant for pollinators and is often used in native plant gardens for its ecological value.
